summary:
A fast learner, gregarious and flexible individual who is capable of working under pressure with ease. An effective communicator who is passionate about his work with an insatiable desire to make a difference. Mentorship and creativity are my strongest assets. Focus, determination, perseverance and pro-activity are traits I live with. I am calm in stressful situations and operate with a solution oriented approach. I have a positive attitude in any situation.

Completed my MBA from Nyenrode Business University and currently employed with FedEx Express as IT Project Manager.

The 1-year program at Nyenrode will help me understand the importance of building strong relationships; stimulating entrepreneurship, international business and taking into account the values, beliefs and needs of all related parties in society.The diversity and intensity of the International MBA will prepare me for the needs of different business sectors and assist me in understanding various personalities and associated cultures.

Skills: 
Six Sigma: Quality management and Process Improvement

Project Management:
Cost, Time, Quality and Stakeholder management

Sustainability:
Business Model, Product/Service and Process innovation. Corporate Social Responsibility and CSV,Triple Bottom Line and Circular Business Model. Understanding and Estimating the True value and True cost of the company.

Strategy:
Assessment and creation of Corporate-Level, Business level and Operational Level Strategies

Organizational Leadership & Talent Management:
Creation of Talent Value chain through Human Capital, Social Capital and Business Capital

Financial:
Measuring and Valuing companies: McKinsey Way.

Value Chain:
Value chain optimization through lead time and cycle time improvement.

I’m always seeking new challenges and projects, so if I can be of assistance, feel free to contact me directly at mohammadadilashraff@gmail.com

awards.issuer: Victoria University of Wellington, New Zealand

awards.title: Participant Certificate
awards.description: 2016 Global Enterprise Experience was an experiential learning event to develop skills in managing global teams with a business focus. The motive for students, was to participate in this event, with an interest in developing skills in international business, cross cultural management, social entrepreneurship, economic development, or business communications. Our team had to come up with a "six-page business concept proposal for a profitable product or service that fosters social cohesion" focusing on refugees, children, elderly, disabled or remote communities, with projects as varied as sports, art, environment, water or food among dozens of other possibilities
awards.issuer: Victoria University of Wellington, New Zealand

projects.title: Master Thesis: The explorative study on sustainable collection and recycling structure within Europe: The case of Fairphone
projects.description:
A research consultancy project on setting up a recycling program for Fairphone, to take back their phones and modules through sustainable collection and recycling structure. 

To come with a feasibility plan of sustainable collection of Fairphone (including battery) and Fairphone  (without battery) within Europe, to move the organization towards a Circular Business Model.

projects.title: London Banking Tour - Morgan Stanley and Nomura - Bank Street
projects.description: As part of our MBA at Nyenrode, the whole batch travelled to London for a banking tour. During this trip we visited Morgan Stanley, Nomura, Rabobank, MAN Group and Bridgepoint Capital. Topics discussed were related to Public Markets, Securities Organization & Distribution, Regulation, Private Markets, M&A deal structuring and Alternative Investments.

contributors.headline: Senior IT Project/Program Manager/SP/PRINCE2/MBA

projects.title: Dell Case for Nyenrode IMBA Students
projects.description:
With the expected upcoming merger of Dell and EMC, both companies will go through a change
to become one company. A challenge was presented to Nyenrode IMBA students to come up with innovative and creative ideas as to how Dell is going to meet the expected challenges of managing, mobilizing, understanding and leading change? What leadership styles, conditions and behavior should be applied in which situation during the change process? 3 key success factors to develop One Culture and actions to be put in place  to stay focused on our customers during the change process.

projects.title: Ericsson: Organizing best growth in new industries with Gender Diversity and Talent Management
projects.description:
Ericsson is changing from 1 industry (telecommunication) to multiple industries. By
2020 about 25% of Ericsson’s revenues should come from non-telco customers. In
essence, Ericsson is re-inventing itself. In that regard, What is the best approach to face these challenges, in terms of organization, setting focus and secure early successes? What are the lessons learned in other industries and companies?

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for IT Strategy, Planning, monitoring the execution of large scale Agile projects
- Responsible for driving the strategic decision making with relevant stakeholders for complex, large scale projects
- Driving the execution of the initiative using SAFe Agile framework
- Identifying, assessing and managing risks for the success of the project
- Ensuring that realistic project and quality plans are prepared and maintained and tracks all activities against the plan; providing regular and accurate reports to stakeholders, as appropriate
- Monitoring costs, timescales and resources used, and taking action where these deviate from agreed tolerances.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
-Responsible for the definition, documentation and safe execution of medium to large scale projects, actively participating in all phases of the project.
-Identifying, assessing and managing risks for the success of the project.
-Effectively estimating costs, timescales and resource requirements for the successful delivery of the project(s) to agreed terms of reference.
-Ensuring that realistic project and quality plans are prepared and maintained and tracks all activities against the plan; providing regular and accurate reports to stakeholders, as appropriate.
-Monitoring costs, timescales and resources used, and taking action where these deviate from agreed tolerances. 
-Ensuring that delivered solutions are implemented within these criteria.
-Managing the change control procedure and ensuring that project deliverables are completed within planned cost, timescale and resource budgets, and are signed off.
-Acting as the liaison between TNT Global IT technical functions, Service Providers and the Business; driving value from vendor relationships; facilitating effective communications, operations and efficient delivery.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager- Business Change Implementation

profile_positions.description:
- Implementing one version of the truth in relation to the use of data and data elements within Transition and the various tools in use (Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Command Center)
- Developing common processes and a related governance structure that can be used to safeguard one version of the truth in all aspects
- Developing related tools (macro's and workflows) to make the common processes as efficient as possible
- Developing and maintaining a detailed master planning that is based on the one version of the truth data and data elements
- To support transition PMO in the maintenance of the transition central data repository and recommend improvements to structure and content (standardization)
profile_positions.title: Global Transition - Trainee

profile_positions.description:
5 years 6 months of rich work experience in the Wealth Management domain of manual and testing..Experience in various types of testing – Functional, Regression, Scenario and Web based.

Functional Skill includes :
•	Exposure in preparation of Test plans,Test Strategy ,Risk and Mitigation Strategy.
•	Creation of project plan and SOW, taking into considerations the limitations in capacity and agreed SLA’s and compliance standards. Formulated proper escalation channels for high severity issues.
•	Involved in Project Estimations. RFP and change request creation, cost estimation
•	Strong knowledge of STLC, SDLC and V-Model environment software development process.
•	Ability to write test cases and test scenario, review, run and generate test reports.
•	Preparation of Test cases and Execution & Reporting.
•	Ability to handle a team of testers while working on multiple deliveries simultaneously. 
•	Coordinating smooth implementation of test plans with the development team.
•	Involved in Integration testing, Regression Testing, User Acceptance Testing, execution of Test cases, capturing, reviewing and analyzing test results.
•	Involved in Defect review meetings with the all the stakeholders – Business , Business Analysis team and Development team along with the testing team for the resolution of the defects.
•	Reporting the progress of the Project on a Daily/ Monthly basis to Team Leader and Onsite Counterparts.
•	Experience in preparation of process related documents such as: Trace-ability Matrix,Review Reports,Audit Reports, Test Metrics and Reporting.
•	Attending weekly project checkpoint meetings and addressing issues related to test activities
•	Training the new members in the team and getting them productive quickly by implementing best practices
•	A complete process oriented individual and striving to achieve the best of quality for the customers. KPI’s metrics creation for each project along with utilization report.
profile_positions.title: Backup QA Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
•	Led a 15-member team from across India and United States, China and the UK for Testing and Support of business critical applications used by Morgan Stanley as part of Application Life cycle management (ALCM).
•	Project startup activities, including inventory analysis and application rationalization.
•	Request For Proposal and Change Request creation and closure. Overseeing the implementation of the CR changes in the workflow/activities. Managing and interacting with different stakeholders as part of project requirement.
•	Monitored periodic project issues/concerns from teams across India and US and assigned appropriate ownership to them. Ensured that learning and changes from the old CR are properly implemented and followed.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
•	Led a 42-member team for end to end testing of all the applications supported by Morgan Stanley  
•	Trained team members on various CMMI (Capability Maturity Model Integration) quality guidelines. 
•	As a Project Lead, conducted team meetings, attended client status calls, worked closely with the client-side manager and onsite coordinators.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead-Capital Markets Team

profile_positions.description:
•	Application life cycle management of all the 3rd party applications used by Morgan Stanley.
•	Created process flow and best practice design for process improvement.
•	Improved the process efficiency by 80% as part of DMAIC SIX SIGMA. Resulted savings up to 29K USD, annually.
•	Received appreciation emails from clients for various issues resolved and tasks completed.
•	Received the “On the Spot” award from TCS for my performance in the Windows 7 User Acceptance Testing project.
